KB_shortcut_simple_2_desc.message: 登入至 KeePass / 選擇符合的登入 / 顯示符合的登入清單
KB_shortcut_simple_2_desc.description: Description of keyboard shortcut setting for the primary action - exact behaviour depends on state when executed

black_list.description: List of items that cause behaviour to be disabled if they match. For example, the list of names of form fields that prevent Kee from searching for logins for the form containing that field.

conn_display_description.message: 一個安全地自動登入多數網站的 Firefox 套件。
conn_display_description.description: A brief description of Kee that gets presented to users to help them decide if they want to allow the connection to KeePass to be permitted.

conn_invalid_message.message: Kee 送出無效的指令至您的密碼資料庫。
conn_invalid_message.description: A form of internal technical error. This can help user's to identify the type of problem they are experiencing.

conn_setup_client_sl_low.message: Kee 使用的安全等級過低無法被密碼伺服器認可。您必須使用安全等級 $1重新啟動認證程序

conn_setup_enter_password_title.description: Heading of the popup that asks the user to authorise the connection to KeePass by typing in a password.

conn_setup_enter_password.message: 請輸入顯示在 KeePass "KeePass Password Safe 2"視窗中的密碼，您無須記住這個密碼。若您輸入錯誤，一段時間之後您可以重試。

conn_setup_expired.message: 您已經使用同一密鑰太長一段時間
conn_setup_expired.description: The KeePassRPC server has detected that the secret key used for communication has expired and the user must therefore re-authenticate.

conn_setup_failed.message: Kee 無法被認可建立連線，可能是因為您輸入的連線密碼錯誤。
conn_setup_failed.description: The most likely cause for this error is that the user typed in the wrong password. Otherwise it's likely to be a bug in the KPRPC protocol, which we would have expected to see some evidence of over the past 5 years.

conn_setup_invalid_param.message: Kee 提供無效的參數。更多資訊參閱：$1
conn_setup_invalid_param.description: This probably indicates a bug in Kee - we sent something to KeePassRPC that it wasn't expecting.

conn_setup_missing_param.message: Kee 無法提供需要的參數。更多資訊請參閱：$1
conn_setup_missing_param.description: This probably indicates a bug in Kee - we failed to send some information to KeePassRPC that it required.

conn_setup_restart.message: Kee 必須重新啟動認證程序。
conn_setup_restart.description: A technical error occurred during the attempt to authorise the link between Kee and KeePassRPC so we need to notify the user that they will need to re-authenticate

conn_setup_retype_password.message: 當提示時請輸入新密碼
conn_setup_retype_password.description: The user needs to re-authorise the connection to KeePass by typing in the new KeePassRPC password they're being shown by KeePass.

conn_setup_server_sl_low.message: Kee 已拒絕密碼伺服器的連線，因其密碼安全等級太低。您必須以安全等級 $1重新啟動認證程序。

conn_setup_client_features_missing.message: Kee must be upgraded to connect to your KeePass Password Safe. Ensure you are running the latest version of the browser add-on / extension.
conn_setup_client_features_missing.description: The KeePassRPC server requires features from Kee that this version does not contain.

conn_setup_server_features_missing.message: The KeePassRPC KeePass Password Safe plugin must be upgraded to allow Kee to connect to it. Ensure you are running the latest version of the KeePassRPC plugin by following the quick and easy instructions at $1
conn_setup_server_features_missing.description: The KeePassRPC server does not offer some features that this version of Kee requires.

conn_sl_high_label.message: Ask for a new connection password every time I start my web browser or KeePass.
conn_sl_high_label.description: Checkbox label to enable high security connection mode when authorising a connection to KeePassRPC

conn_sl_server_min_desc.message: 若安全等級太低將禁止 Kee 連線至 KeePass。在 KeePass 選項中可以設定 KeePass 實際使用的安全等級。

conn_sl_server_min.message: KeePass 可接受的最低安全等級

conn_sl_desc.message: 以下設定控制 Firefox 和 KeePass 的連線安全等級。您也許不需要變更這些設定，更動前請您閱讀以下相關說明頁面。

conn_sl_link.message: 在說明文件中了解更多關於 Firefox 及 KeePass 之間的通訊設定
conn_sl_link.description: Link text to guide user to the manual to get more information about the security of the link to KeePass.

conn_unknown_error.message: 連接您的密碼資料庫時，發生未預期的錯誤。
conn_unknown_error.description: Something went wrong with the KeePassRPC link but we have no idea what.

conn_unknown_protocol.description: Technical error in the communication between Kee and KeePassRPC. Not clear how user could resolve this or if they'll ever see it but it might happen.

further_info_may_follow.description: Phrase used to prefix extra information about a variety of different messages that may or may not be available in the replacement string, usually relating to technical errors and often rendered in the Kee log rather than in a user-facing place.

matched_logins_label.description: Header for panels/sections that contain the logins which Kee matched for this page/form

pref_ConnectionSecurity_heading.description: Heading for panel that contains settings for the security of the connection between Kee and KeePass.

pref_ConnectionSecurity_explain_change.message: Sometimes making a change to the settings below will cause Kee to ask you for a new random password. You do not need to enter the correct password above in order to change these settings, just adjust them and press the button above.
pref_ConnectionSecurity_explain_change.description: Explains what happens if user changes settings for the security of the connection between Kee and KeePass.

srp_connect.description: Button action to authorise the connection between Kee and KeePassRPC. Displayed when the user has entered a password and not changed any connection security settings.

srp_save_connect.description: Button action to authorise the connection between Kee and KeePassRPC and save new connection options. Displayed when the user has entered a password and changed connection security settings.

pref_DoNothing_desc.description: Label for configuring Kee to take no action. Specific context may vary but will relate to auto filling and/or submitting

pref_FillingEntries_heading.description: Heading for section of options panel which contains settings relating to how Kee behaves when filling entries into forms

pref_FillNote_desc.message: 您可以在 KeePass "編輯條目" 對話框中，為個別條目覆寫上面的 "Kee 選擇" 行為。
pref_FillNote_desc.description: Tells user that the settings nearby are global/default and they are able to override on a per-entry basis via KeePass.

pref_FindingEntries_heading.description: Heading for section of options panel which contains settings relating to how Kee behaves when finding entries for a website

pref_Logging_heading.description: The output of text information that reports on the inner-workings of Kee.

pref_SavingEntries_heading.description: Heading for section of options panel which contains settings relating to how Kee behaves when saving new entries

pref_autoFillFormsWithMultipleMatches_la.message: 多重符合的表單應該自動填入並送出

pref_keePassDBToOpen_label.message: 當打開或登入 KeePass 時，使用此資料庫

pref_keePassRPCPort_label.message: 透過此 TCP/IP port 與 KeePass 溝通

pref_keePassRPCPortWarning_label.message: 注意: 改變 KeePass.config 的設定或其他設定可能導致 Kee 無法與 KeePass 溝通
pref_keePassRPCPortWarning_label.description: Displayed to the user near the setting for changing the KeePassRPC port

pref_listAllOpenDBs_label.message: 從所有開啟的 KeePass 資料庫列出登入表單

pref_logLevel_desc.message: 選擇您需要的記錄詳細等級。越高的記錄等級會產生更多的輸出

pref_logLevelDebugging_label.description: Logging level for the most verbose information about Kee's operation

pref_logLevelInformation_label.description: Logging level for important information about Kee's operation

pref_notifyWhenEntryUpdated_label.message: 顯示 "密碼成功更新" 通知
pref_notifyWhenEntryUpdated_label.description: Option to enable or diable the information displayed when a password has been updated

pref_rememberMRUDB_label.message: 記住最常使用的 KeePass 資料庫

pref_rememberMRUGroup_label.message: 記住最常用來儲存的群組
pref_rememberMRUGroup_label.description: Whether Kee will remember the name of the KeePass group most recently chosen by the user

pref_saveFavicons_label.description: Whether or not Kee will save the website's icon when a new entry is saved

pref_searchAllOpenDBs_label.message: 搜尋所有 KeePass 資料庫

pref_when_kee_chooses_standard_form_desc.message: When Kee chooses a matching login for a standard form, Kee should
pref_when_kee_chooses_standard_form_desc.description: Context/label for user when changing setting relating to auto-fill/submit behaviour. A list of potential actions will be displayed immediately after this string and the user can select their preferred behaviour from that list.

pref_when_user_chooses_desc.message: 當您選擇相符的登入, Kee 應該
pref_when_user_chooses_desc.description: Context/label for user when changing setting relating to manual fill/submit behaviour. A list of potential actions will be displayed immediately after this string and the user can select their preferred behaviour from that list.

site_options_invisible_tip_desc.message: 注意: 名稱和 ID 可能和該網頁中可見的標籤名稱不同 (實際名稱要自網頁原始碼中找)
site_options_invisible_tip_desc.description: Explains that the configuration settings might not be what the casual user expects

site_options_list_explain_desc.message: 如果表單符合白名單中的任一項將試著填入；符合黑名單中的任一項則永不自動填入。若網站同時符合兩清單，Kee 亦不填入。
site_options_list_explain_desc.description: Explains how Kee chooses which forms to fill in

pref_Finding_forms_heading.description: Settings heading for how Kee finds forms it is (or isn't) interested in filling in with entries from KeePass

site_options_valid_form_intro_desc.message: Kee 將為所有含有密碼欄(框)的表單試著填入 KeePass 中符合的條目，以下設定可以變更此行為。
site_options_valid_form_intro_desc.description: Explains how Kee chooses which forms to fill in

white_list.description: List of items that cause behaviour to be enabled if they match. For example, the list of names of form fields that force Kee to search for logins for the form containing that field.

Search_tip.message: Start typing to display your matching login entries

PasswordProfilesExplanation_label.message: You can optionally create a different one by selecting a password profile below. Use KeePass to save new profiles.

change_field_explanation.message: Kee will also update the website icon (favicon) and any HTTP Auth Realm information. More complex modifications will require you to manually edit the entry.

change_field_status.message: The selected entry will have all username, password and other form fields replaced with the values you have just entered.

change_url_status.message: The entry's web page address (URL) will be updated with the latest URL.

change_url_option_1.message: Replace the entry's URL (but still fill forms if you visit the old URL)

change_url_option_2.message: Replace the entry's URL (delete the old URL completely)

change_url_option_3.message: Keep the old entry's URL (but still fill forms if you visit the new URL)

change_url_option_4.message: Keep the old entry's URL (don't add the new URL to the entry)

copy.description: Prefixed before a field name and id to indicate to the user that when they click here the value for that field will be copied to the clipboard. Displayed before (left) of the field name with a space between this string and the field name.

showing_options_for.desciption: label for a group of radio buttons that allows the user to change the scope of the settings they are changing - e.g. all websites or just one specific website

generatePassword_copied.message: A new password has been copied to your clipboard.

keepass_history_pointer.message: KeePass has an "undo" feature which you can access from the KeePass "edit entry" dialog window. Click on the "History" tab and then use the "Restore" button to revert to an older version.

loggedIn_tip.message: You are logged in to your '$1' password database
loggedIn_tip.description: Tells the user they are logged into a KeePass database (and gives its name, if any)

loggedInMultiple_tip.message: You are logged in to $1 password databases. '$2' is active.
loggedInMultiple_tip.description: Tells the user they have more than one KeePass database open and tells them which one is active/selected

matchedLogin_tip.description: Tooltip displayed over a matched login in the list of matched logins. Params: 1: entry title, 2: group name, 3: username

multi_page_update_warning.message: Multi-page login forms may also require manual editing.

notifyBarLaunchKeePass_label.message: You are not logged in to your password database.

notifyBarLogSensitiveData_label.message: WARNING: Kee is logging your passwords! If you have not intentionally enabled this setting you should disable it immediately
notifyBarLogSensitiveData_label.description: Displayed only when an advanced setting is potentially mistakenly or maliciously reconfigured

notifyBarLoginToKeePassButton_tip.message: Login to your KeePass database to enable Kee

notifyBarNeverForSiteButton_label.description: Button user can click to quickly set the configuraiton option to prevent Kee from asking if they want to save a new password on this site

saveMultiPagePasswordText.message: Do you want Kee to save this multi-page password?

savePasswordText.message: Do you want Kee to save this password?

close.description: Action user can click on to close/dismiss a panel or other user interface element

autoclose_countdown.description: Label for a user interface element which allows the user to disable the auto-close functionality. Also tells the user how many seconds are remaining before the auto-close functionality triggers.

autoclose_cancelled.description: Tells the user that the panel auto-close functionality has been disabled for this panel.

add.description: Action button for user to add an item to a collection. E.g. add an entry to the list of site-specific settings overrides

edit.description: Action button for user to edit an item within a collection. E.g. edit an entry within the list of site-specific settings overrides

site_specific_settings_checkbox_explanat.message: Settings from "All Websites" will apply to each section below unless you enable the setting using the checkbox next to it.
site_specific_settings_checkbox_explanat.description: Explains to the user how the site-specific settings can be enabled and what happens in the default situation

enter_valid_regex.message: Enter a valid Regex or select a different type
enter_valid_regex.description: Validation error message displayed to user when they have configured the properties of a site specific configuration to be a regular expression (Regex) but supplied a website value that is not a valid regex

site_properties_weight_warning.message: You'll need to carefully check the weights of other configurations if you choose to make use of this advanced feature.
site_properties_weight_warning.description: Warning to users that the match weighting feature of site-specific config is an advanced feature

target.description: For differentiating which part of a URL will be matched - e.g domain, hostname or complete page address

method.description: For differentiating how a text string will be matched - e.g exact, prefix or regex

weight.description: A number that can be compared to others in order to decide which associated configuration takes precendence.

site_specific_settings_inherit.message: Use the same setting as all websites
site_specific_settings_inherit.description: Option for user to say that they want to use whatever the setting is for the top-level settings for all websites, rather than overriding it with a setting for this specific site.

password.description: Amazingly, didn't have a need for this translation until v2.0 ;-)

conn_setup_client_sl_low_resolution.description: Button that will change the security level Kee attempts to use when connecting to the KeePassRPC server.

learn_more.description: Action/button/link to send the user to somewhere that they can read more about a topic/concept

dont_show_again.description: Button user can click on to cause a message to hide and not reappear

upgrade_kee.description: Button user can click on to load a web page with instructions on how to upgrade Kee

pref_when_one_matching_network_login.message: When Kee finds only one matching network login (e.g. HTTP Auth), automatically login
pref_when_one_matching_network_login.description: When the user selects this option, they will be shown the popup dialog with all matching entries for network authentication, unless there is only one match. If not enabled, the user will always see the list of matching logins.

network_authentication.description: Heading for popup dialog displayed when HTTP Auth or a proxy requires authentication.

network_auth_proxy_description.message: A proxy requires you to authenticate with it before you can access $1
network_auth_proxy_description.description: Instructions for popup dialog displayed when a proxy requires authentication.

network_auth_http_auth_description.message: A website requires you to authenticate with it before you can access $1. The website says: $2
network_auth_http_auth_description.description: Instructions for popup dialog displayed when a site requires authentication using HTTP Auth.

network_auth_choose.message: Choose a login from the list below or close this window to manually enter the required login information.
network_auth_choose.description: Instructions for popup dialog displayed when a site or proxy requires network authentication.

save_login.description: Heading for panel that allows user to create or update a new login entry

saveLatestLogin.description: Action link for user to click (e.g. from the browser popup or a context menu) when they want to save the most recently submitted data as a new entry

welcome_to_kee.description: Header for release notes page. Will have a version suffix added to it. E.g. Welcome to Kee 2.0

the_new_name_for_keefox.description: Subheader for release notes page to give context for users upgrading from KeeFox

kee_install_notes_intro.message: Kee stores your passwords in a secure separate password manager called KeePass Password Safe 2. It's full of great features and Kee keeps your everyday internet login tasks simple and secure.
kee_install_notes_intro.description: Text to introduce Kee to new users and encourage following the next steps to get it set up to work with KeePass

kee_install_notes_keepass.message: You need to run KeePass so that Kee can connect to it. If KeePass is not installed on your computer, you can easily download and install it yourself.
kee_install_notes_keepass.description: Text to introduce KeePass to new users and encourage following the necessary steps to get Kee to work

kee_install_notes_keepassrpc.message: You'll need to install the KeePassRPC.plgx plugin for KeePass too, if you haven't already. It is as easy as putting a file in the right place on your computer and restarting KeePass.
kee_install_notes_keepassrpc.description: Text to introduce KeePassRPC.plgx to new users and encourage following the necessary steps to get Kee to work

point_user_to_kee_news_announcement.message: You can find much more information about Kee 2.0 in the following news article and the links included within it:
point_user_to_kee_news_announcement.description: Will have a URL suffixed after the colon

point_user_to_upgrade_instructions.message: If you have not upgraded KeeFox recently, you will need to manually copy a file into your KeePass plugins folder. Instructions can be found at:
point_user_to_upgrade_instructions.description: Will have a URL suffixed after the colon

point_user_to_install_instructions_start.message: Instructions for both of the above steps can be found on our
point_user_to_install_instructions_start.description: Left part of a sentance that contains a link to the community forum in the middle. For new installations

point_user_to_install_instructions_end.description: Right part of a sentance that contains a link to the community forum in the middle. For new installations

point_user_to_tutorial_start.message: Please spend a few minutes going through the new
point_user_to_tutorial_start.description: Left part of a sentance that contains a link to the interactive tutorial page in the middle. For upgrade installations

point_user_to_tutorial_end.message: to learn how to use the new version.
point_user_to_tutorial_end.description: Right part of a sentance that contains a link to the interactive tutorial page in the middle. For upgrade installations

point_user_to_tutorial_start_install.message: Please then spend a few minutes going through the new
point_user_to_tutorial_start_install.description: Left part of a sentance that contains a link to the interactive tutorial page in the middle. For new installations

point_user_to_tutorial_end_install.message: to learn how to use Kee.
point_user_to_tutorial_end_install.description: Right part of a sentance that contains a link to the interactive tutorial page in the middle. For new installations

point_user_to_tutorial_link_text.description: Name of the link to the interactive tutorial page

point_user_to_forum_link_text.description: Name of the link to the community forum

version_2_upgrade_intro.message: Version 2.0 brings exciting new features and some enforced changes in order to support Firefox 57 and higher.

notification_raised_title.message: Kee has a notification to show you
notification_raised_title.description: Title of a transient native notification displayed on the user's screen to alert them to a notification in the Kee browser action popup.

notification_yellow_background.message: The Kee button has a yellow background when a new notification appears.
notification_yellow_background.description: Part of the message within a transient native notification displayed on the user's screen to alert them to a notification in the Kee browser action popup.

notification_only_shown_some_times.message: This additional popup notification will only be shown a small number of times.
notification_only_shown_some_times.description: Appended to the message of a transient native notification displayed on the user's screen when we show the message only a handful of times before assuming they have learnt the contents of the message.

notification_save_password_tip.message: Click on the Kee button (in your toolbar) and then "Save latest login"
notification_save_password_tip.description: Part of the message within a transient native notification displayed on the user's screen to tell them how to save a password (especially important for those upgrading from KeeFox since the behaviour has changed)
